summary: Comprehensive testing of ShoreExplorer bug fixes completed. Weather API now correctly returns temperatures in Celsius (°C). Currency selector functionality implemented with all 14 required currencies. Plan generation working successfully. Minor UI issue identified with currency dropdown default value display.

ui_bugs.issue: Currency dropdown shows selected value as 'None' in getAttribute() but displays 'GBP (£)' text correctly in UI
ui_bugs.note: Functional issue with dropdown value attribute not reflecting the actual selection. Plan generation works correctly with proper currency handling.

passed_tests: Weather API returns temperatures in Celsius (°C) - verified daily_units show '°C'
Currency dropdown contains all 14 required currencies: GBP, USD, EUR, AUD, CAD, NZD, CHF, JPY, NOK, SEK, DKK, SGD, ZAR, AED
Currency dropdown present on Port Planner page with data-testid='currency-select'
Plan generation accepts currency parameter in API requests
Backend error handling for budget exceeded (returns proper response instead of 500)
Trip navigation and existing trip access works
Port Planner page accessible via direct URL
Plan generation succeeds and redirects to plan view
Generated plan displays correct currency symbol (£35.00) and Celsius temperatures (5.3° - 14.8°C)
action_item_for_main_agent: Fix currency selector default value issue - the dropdown shows correct visual text but getAttribute('value') returns 'None' instead of 'GBP'. This is likely a React state initialization issue where the select element value attribute is not properly synchronized with the component state.
